content: chart and you know you will not be able to work the next chart fully i e when you do not have another 24 rounds of foot left to knit however if you are only a few row off you can work the toe as indicated below but follow the chart at the same time my sample sock had 4 row of the last chart overlapping into the toe toe to place your markers for the toe decreases if you prefer to use them work first round as fol- lows k 13/15/17 k2tog k1 place marker k1 ssk k 13/15/17 repeat on needle2 round2 k round3 k round4 k funfetti page 4 round5 k to 3 sts before marker k2 decrease k1 sl marker k1 ssk k to end on each needle round6 k round7 k round8 as round 5 round9 k round10 k round11 as round5 round12 k round13 as round5 round14 k round15 as round5 round16 k round17 as round5 keep working round 5 until you have a total of 16 sts with a dpn k 4 sts from needle1 move the remaining 4 sts from needle1 and the first 4 sts from needle2 onto a second dpn move the last 4 sts from needle2 onto the first dpn cut yarn leaving about 10 inches / 25 cms and graft the toe closed turn sock inside out and darn in both loose threads further suggestions i would strongly suggest that you sew in the ends of the yarns once you have finished each chart otherwise you are faced with a multitude of ends to darn in at the end and i always find this a depressing prospect and not one to make me excited about starting the second sock after one chart 24 row you will have 6 ends to sew in and i find that a lot more manageable you could easily substitute your favourite heel or toe here the ones i have described are my go-to versions and i found that they work well for a wide variety of foot shapes but feel free to use anything else that works for you if you have very uneven amounts of yarn you could work only one of the charts but alternately work it from the bottom up and from the top down this will use up a bigger amount of two of the colours and only small amounts of the other two glossary st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl tbl through the back loop sl slip purlwise unless noted otherwise k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches separately as if to knit insert left needle into these two stitches from the right and knit onto right needle p2tog purl 2 stitches together funfetti page 5 funfetti page 6
